page.title: 10HOME LIFE IN THE BERROW AREA
page.content: Home life is stable, perhaps old fashioned. Young Worcestershire children take school transport or walk to Castlemorton: Gloucestershire children to Redmarley. At 11 they attend Comprehensive school at Upton or Newent. The main meal is often in the evening.{Vegetables and eggs}are produced and bought locally.{Village {shops}are widely used: nearby towns provide for all needs. Bread, milk and newspapers are delivered. There are travelling shops and library. Bottled gas is widely used as there is no mains gas: all houses have electric- ity. Mains water is common but some wells are used. There is some main drainage but most premises rely on individual septic tanks. Most families have a car and bicycle.{Dogs}and{cats are common, also{goats}and sometimes a{pony.
